docna.cdata!:
Zambia - Recovery Program : Credit 1720 -
            Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Zambia - Recovery Program :
            Credit 1720 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of this credit is to help
            provide the minimum level of imports needed for
            Zambia's Recovery Program and thereby help sustain the
            momentum of the policy and institutional reforms. This will
            allow the productive sectors of the economy to respond to
            the incentives and favorable economic environment
            established by the reforms and provide the increased supply
            of goods and services needed to support structural change in
            the economy. The Credit will finance: a) imports of goods
            with the exception of defense and luxury consumer goods, and
            b) technical assistance and training. The latter component
            will improve foreign exchange management by the Bank of
            Zambia, audit implementation of Zambia Consolidated Copper
            Mines' 5-year Production and Investment Plan, improve
            debt management in the Ministry of Finance, and devise a
            mechanism for limiting maize subsidies to low income
            families. By increasing domestic supplies of spare parts,
            raw materials, intermediate goods and other productive
            inputs, as well as basic consumption goods, the project
            would support the recovery of Zambia's economy.
